column4: so I'm a windows user but I'd like to install Ubuntu... 'cause I love it as I tried it... so I got a second hd and I'd like to install ubuntu on it, keeping windows as primary OS... what kinda settings should I use for installing or... is anything I should be supposed to take care of?
you should simply tell the installer to take over the second drive.
it will be installed to the mbr of the first drive, and will recognize & set up your windows on the first drive for booting
precisely. Ubuntu is not so stupid as to cut off new users from their windows
